meanings.definition: A person who plates or coats objects with a thin layer of metal.
meanings.sent1: The skilled platers carefully coated the jewelry with a shiny layer of gold.
meanings.sent2: The platers at the workshop were busy adding a silver finish to the antique vases.
meanings.sent3: The platers decided to have a race to see who could coat the most items in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The platers were like artists, turning ordinary objects into metallic masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming work of the platers transformed the dull items into dazzling treasures.

meanings.definition: A tool used for plating or coating objects with a thin layer of metal.
meanings.sent1: The platers were neatly arranged on the table, ready for the craftsmen to use.
meanings.sent2: The new platers in the set made the process of adding a metallic sheen much easier.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous apprentice hid the platers, causing a temporary delay in production.
meanings.sent4: The platers gleamed under the workshop lights, waiting to transform plain objects.
meanings.sent5: The delicate platers were essential for achieving a flawless metal finish on the items.
